ch.epfl.biop.imaris

Class StatsQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.biop.imaris.StatsQuery

  • public class StatsQuery
extends Object
    This class is based on a Builder model to obtain selected statistics from an Imaris cStatisticValues object It allows for selecting specific item IDs, stat names, channels and timepoints. Statistics are returned in the form of a ResultsTable Multiple images are not directly supported, as we have never had a use for it. See the example uses in the source code of GetStatisticsDemo
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Olivier Burri

    • Method Detail

      • selectId

        public StatsQuery selectId(Integer id)
        Allows for the selection of a specific ID. Note that IDs are not necesarily continuous nor necesarily start at 0. These are the IDs as per Imaris's ID value in the GUI
        Parameters:
        id - the ID to recover statistics from
        Returns:

      • selectIds

        public StatsQuery selectIds(List<Integer> ids)
        Allows to set a list of IDs from which to get statistics from
        Parameters:
        ids - the list of IDs to recover statistics from
        Returns:

      • selectStatistic

        public StatsQuery selectStatistic(String name)
        Allows to select the name of the statistic to export. These are the same names as in the Imaris GUI **Minus** the channel or image (eg. do not enter "Intensity Sum" Ch1=1 Img=1, just "Intensity Sum") Use selectChannels(List) and selectChannel(Integer) to specify channels
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the statistic to recover as it appears in the Imaris GUI.
        Returns:

      • selectStatistics

        public StatsQuery selectStatistics(List<String> names)
        Allows to set a list of IDs from which to get statistics from
        Parameters:
        names - the list of statistic names to recover as they appear in the Imaris GUI
        Returns:

      • selectTime

        public StatsQuery selectTime(Integer timepoint)
        Allows to select the timepoint of the statistics to export. 0-based Careful. Imaris results are one-based for timepoints
        Parameters:
        timepoint - the timepoint
        Returns:

      • selectTimes

        public StatsQuery selectTimes(List<Integer> timepoints)
        Allows to set a list of timepoints from which to get statistics from Careful. Imaris results are one-based for timepoints
        Parameters:
        timepoints -
        Returns:

      • get

        public ij.measure.ResultsTable get()
                            throws Imaris.Error
        Heavy lifting function that performs the requested operation and returns a table It is rather naive. It will go through each row of the raw Imaris statistics and see if that row matches the names, channels and timepoints that were requested. If they all match
        Returns:
        Throws:
        Imaris.Error
